Episodes.Title: Double Trouble
Episodes.Plot: When Shaun dresses as the farmer he suddenly has the power to boss Bitzer around, so he decides to throw a party. All goes to plan until Shaun encounters the real farmer...

Episodes.Title: Draw The Line
Episodes.Plot: The flock hijack a road line-painting machine and cause chaos while creating giant works of art in the field. However, will farmer appreciate their art?

Episodes.Title: Sheepless Nights
Episodes.Plot: When the sheep's stable's roof is broken, rain leaks in. The sheep try to gain dry land, but the only space they can find is the pig's sty, whom the pigs fart during the big sleep.

Episodes.Title: Spring Lamb
Episodes.Plot: A reluctant Timmy tries to avoid bath time and in trying to escape he gets a spring attached to his tail. It's up to the flock to catch the bouncing baby sheep and return him to the tub before he destroys the farm.

Episodes.Title: Strictly No Dancing
Episodes.Plot: The farmer hits the dance floor and attempts to learn how to ballroom dance using Pidsley as his dancing partner. The din they create annoys the sheep so much that Shaun decides to stop them.

Episodes.Title: Who's The Caddy
Episodes.Plot: The farmer comes across his old golf clubs and decides to knock a few balls around, instantly putting his back out in the process. Shaun takes the opportunity to learn how to play, while Bitzer is forced to tend to his injured master inside the house.

Episodes.Title: Hair Today, Gone Tomorrow
Episodes.Plot: The farmer gets ready for a date and wants to look his best, so it's time to dust off his prized hairpiece. Shaun can't resist trying the wig on but loses it while showing off to the flock. The race is on as Shaun and Bitzer try to return the wig in time for the farmer's big night.

Episodes.Title: Bagpipe Buddy
Episodes.Plot: The sheep discover a set of bagpipes on the rubbish dump which they immediately misidentify as a sick emu. They set about trying to nurse it back to health before releasing it back into the wild.

Episodes.Title: Supersize Timmy
Episodes.Plot: Timmy accidentally eats a tomato grown with Miracle-Grow fertilizer, and expands to become the King Kong of sheep. Shaun must keep the giant toddler out of sight while trying to figure out how to return him to normal size. In the end a Duck eats the growth spurt and grows even bigger than a house.

Episodes.Title: Lock Out
Episodes.Plot: While preparing for bed, the farmer manages to lock himself out of the house and is stuck outside in his pyjamas. He decides to spend the night in the barn but his incessant snoring drives the flock mad. Shaun concocts a plan to return him to his bed without waking him up.

Episodes.Title: Cheetah Cheater
Episodes.Plot: A wildlife film inspires Pidsley the cat to play a prank on the flock by disguising himself as a leopard. Shaun is convinced there is a huge beast on the loose and concocts a plan to catch it.

Episodes.Title: Ewe've Been Framed
Episodes.Plot: Shaun accidentally breaks the farmer's glasses; he and Bitzer have their work cut out trying to prevent their shortsighted master from having mishaps around the farm.

Episodes.Title: Bitzer's New Hat
Episodes.Plot: The Farmer gives Bitzer a horrible new hat. Bitzer is very upset as he treasured his old hat. The flock rallies round to try to cheer him up with a selection of dashing alternative head gear.

Episodes.Title: Hide And Squeak
Episodes.Plot: The Farmer is terrorised when a cute mouse appears in the farmhouse and Pidsley the cat is ordered to dispose of the rodent. When the mouse takes refuge in Shaun's fleece, the flock persuade him to protect their new friend from the pitiless cat.

Episodes.Title: Frantic Romantic
Episodes.Plot: The Farmer trying to impress his new date by cooking a romantic dinner. Unfortunately, the Farmer can't cook and Bitzer is a useless maitre d'. Can Shaun and the flock save the day when they take over the catering behind the scenes?

Episodes.Title: Everything Must Go
Episodes.Plot: Everything must go when the farmer sets up a stall by the side of the road and leaves Bitzer in charge. The lazy sheepdog soon tires of his role and gives Shaun the job. He proves to be a much better salesman than Bitzer and the flock are only too happy to get stuck in, selling pretty much all the farmer's worldly possessions.

Episodes.Title: Party Animals
Episodes.Plot: The farmer throws a fancy-dress house party for his birthday. When Bitzer loses all the invitations, however, Shaun saves the day again. Disguised in their own ingenious costumes, the sheep stand in as the guests and have a good old knees-up. But can they fool the farmer into believing he is surrounded by his friends?

Episodes.Title: Cat Got Your Brain
Episodes.Plot: Two evil bungling alien scientists transport Pidsley the cat and Shaun aboard their flying saucer. Unfortunately, a foolish error causes the aliens to swap the animals' brains around. Shaun and Pidsley are dumped back to Earth, not realizing they are in the wrong bodies - leading to much confusion around the farm before the aliens return to correct their mistake.At the end, everyone's brains were also swapped.

Episodes.Title: Two's Company
Episodes.Plot: Shaun is smitten when a bedraggled new sheep lands among the flock. After a wash in the sheep dip, the newcomer turns out to be quite attractive and Shaun immediately falls head over hoof for her. While Bitzer goes on a journey to find her rightful owner, the flock are kept amused by Shaun's romantic antics.

Episodes.Title: In The Doghouse
Episodes.Plot: Bitzer's kennel is accidentally destroyed by the farmer's tractor crashing into it and the canny canine hopes the farmer will replace it with a new deluxe model. But when he sees his master's clumsy attempt to build a new kennel, Bitzer is so horrified that he packs his bags and leaves home. Shaun, however, hopes to tempt Bitzer to return with the kennel of his dreams. At the first scene, the flock are having a party at the chicken coop.

Episodes.Title: The Boat
Episodes.Plot: The farmer gets Bitzer to help him renovate an old boat, but as soon as his back is turned the sheep and pigs turn the refurbishment into a swashbuckling game of pirates.

Episodes.Title: What's Up, Dog?
Episodes.Plot: A wayward balloonist lands in the sheeps field. Shaun and his friends are intrigued by the hot air balloon and inadvertently take to the skies. Down on the ground an ever more desperate Bitzer runs himself ragged attempting to bring the wayward sheep back down to Earth safely.

Episodes.Title: Cock-A-Doodle Shaun
Episodes.Plot: The cockerel is missing and there's no one to wake up the farm. When Shaun discovers the cockerel has been snatched by the greedy fox, he sets off with Bitzer on a daring rescue mission. Will they get the cockerel back in time to wake up the rest of the farm?

Episodes.Title: Bitzer's Basic Training
Episodes.Plot: Bitzer thinks The Farmer is planning to replace him, so Shaun helps to knock his friend into shape. Unfortunately Bitzer goes completely over the top with his training regime and starts running the farm with military precision driving everyone crazy.

Episodes.Title: Chip Off The Old Block
Episodes.Plot: The Farmer has taken up sculpting, but unintentionally drops a huge slab of stone on top of Timmy's teddy. Shaun and the flock must struggle and strain to lift the heavy block and retrieve the precious toy.

Episodes.Title: Pig Trouble
Episodes.Plot: When Bitzer injures his foot and can't work, the Farmer chooses the pigs to take over his role. The power crazy pigs take the opportunity to turn the farm into a porky paradise - at the sheep's expense. Bitzer tries in vain to warn his master what is going on behind his back, but it's Shaun who steps in and restores the status quo ante.

Episodes.Title: Bitzer From The Black Lagoon
Episodes.Plot: While trying to retrieve his ball, Bitzer falls into a muddy pond. When Shaun sees a big, blobby, shambling 'thing' squelching across the field, he's convinced they are being attacked by a swamp monster.

Episodes.Title: Zebra Ducks Of The Serengeti
Episodes.Plot: After getting covered in soot, two hapless ducks are mistaken for a pair of rare African Zebra Ducks. Seeing a way to make money, the farmer transforms Shaun's field into an exotic duck enclosure, which he gleefully opens to the public. Shaun doesn't appreciate losing his field and sets about exposing the fraud.

Episodes.Title: Whistleblower
Episodes.Plot: Bitzer loses his precious whistle and tests out a trumpet as a replacement. Before long, the power of the trumpet goes to his head and his fanfares and jazz styled bugling drives the flock around the bend.

Episodes.Title: The Big Chase
Episodes.Plot: When Timmy drives off on the farmer's brand new quad bike, Shaun, Bitzer and the flock have to give chase by any means available. Very soon half the animals on the farm have joined in the chase. Can the sheep rescue Timmy and return the quad bike before the farmer finds out?

Episodes.Title: The Magpie
Episodes.Plot: A magpie has nested in the big tree and is causing chaos by stealing everything around the farm. The magpie's nest soon begins to fill up with loot and Shaun has to come up with a brilliant plan to outwit the burgling bird.

Episodes.Title: Operation Pidsley
Episodes.Plot: While the farmer is away on a night out, the sheep sneak into the farmhouse for a party.

Episodes.Title: Pig Swill Fly
Episodes.Plot: The farm is looking spotless and everyone is on their best behaviour when the dreaded farm Inspector pays a visit.

Episodes.Title: Shirley Whirley
Episodes.Plot: In a bid to help move Shirley around the farm Shaun has the idea of fitting up Shirley with wheels.

Episodes.Title: Foxy Laddie
Episodes.Plot: A fox arrives at the farm, disguising himself as a handsome ram to infiltrate the flock.

Episodes.Title: Shaun Goes Potty
Episodes.Plot: The sheep have fun with the Farmer's new pool table.

Episodes.Title: An Ill Wind
Episodes.Plot: The Farmer receives a huge electricity bill and decides to build his own wind turbine to power the farmhouse.

Episodes.Title: Fireside Favourite
Episodes.Plot: Bitzer has caught a cold and the Farmer decides to tuck him up in the house to recover.

Episodes.Title: Snowed In
Episodes.Plot: Shaun and his chums awake to find the farm covered in snow!

Episodes.Title: We Wish Ewe A Merry Christmas
Episodes.Plot: The sheep learn the farmer will be spending Christmas day alone, so the animals decorate the farmhouse to give him a magical time.
